solution:
```python
n = int(input())
a = list(map(int, input().split()))

colors = {
    (1, 399): "gray",
    (400, 799): "brown",
    (800, 1199): "green",
    (1200, 1599): "cyan",
    (1600, 1999): "blue",
    (2000, 2399): "yellow",
    (2400, 2799): "orange",
    (2800, 3199): "red",
}

unique_colors = set()
for rating in a:
    for range_tuple, color in colors.items():
        if range_tuple[0] <= rating <= range_tuple[1]:
            unique_colors.add(color)
            break
    else:
        unique_colors.add("other")

min_colors = len(unique_colors)
if min_colors > 1:
    min_colors = len(set([colors.get((400, 799)) if 400 <= x <= 799 else colors.get((800, 1199)) if 800 <= x <= 1199 else "other" for x in a]))


max_colors = len(unique_colors)

print(min_colors, max_colors)

```
